climbs.name: The Talon
climbs.fa: Bill Leventhal and Mike Lechlinksi, November 1990

content.description:
Sharpen your claws for this tricky overhanging arete which features excellent rock and positioning. Were this twice as tall it would be a classic but it's still a worthy endeavor in a unique setting. Three stars out of five.

The rap anchor is a little funky and may still include an ancient fixed hex as part of the set-up.
content.location: Right side of the north face.

climbs.name: South Face Route (aka Owl)
climbs.fa: Craig Fry and Dave Evans, February 1985

content.description: Uninspiring climbing up a grainy crack with loose plates up high. This was the first and easiest route to the top of the formation. The rap anchor is a little funky and may still include an ancient fixed hex as part of the set-up.
content.location: The obvious crack splitting the south face.

climbs.name: Broken Wing
climbs.fa: Bill Leventhal and Will Oxx, November 1990

content.description: Fun climbing up steep somewhat loose edges on nice patina rock. Could use some traffic to clean it up more. The rap anchor is a little funky and may still include an ancient fixed hex as part of the set-up.
content.location: Left side of the north face.
